meanings.definition: Resembling a cask in shape or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The casky barrel stood in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The wooden table had a casky design on its surface.
meanings.sent3: The casky chair looked like it could roll away on its own!
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a casky quality, deep and resonant.
meanings.sent5: The casky clouds in the sky resembled giant barrels floating above us.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a cask.
meanings.sent1: The casky smell of wine filled the cellar.
meanings.sent2: The old tavern had a casky atmosphere that reminded me of the countryside.
meanings.sent3: He wore a casky hat that made him look like a walking barrel!
meanings.sent4: The casky taste of the aged whiskey lingered on his tongue.
meanings.sent5: The casky wood of the ship gave it a sturdy and reliable feel.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of a cask.
meanings.sent1: The casky sound of the rolling barrel echoed through the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The winery had a casky tradition of aging their wines in oak barrels.
meanings.sent3: She had a casky sense of humor, always making barrel-related jokes.
meanings.sent4: The casky texture of the fabric reminded her of the rough surface of a barrel.
meanings.sent5: The casky aroma of the brewery transported him back to his childhood memories of playing near the barrels.
